description: An exploration of the impact and developments in open source software during Donald Trump's presidency. This article examines the role of federal policies, technological advancements, and economic influences on open source frameworks like Kubernetes and TensorFlow. Additionally, it addresses challenges and opportunities presented by open source initiatives in the public sector and the lasting legacy of OSS in shaping future technology strategies.
keywords: open source software, Trump presidency, OSS, federal policies, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, open source sponsorship, government funding, economic impact, technology strategy, software development, public sector engagement, net neutrality, cybersecurity, intellectual property, software forking
title: Embracing Open Source: Reflection on Software Developments During Trump's Presidency
